Hello, Mrs. Doyle.
Did you find it?
Yes. No. She looks at Ben.
You know when you talk about Charlotte all the time, it scares the girls away. That last girlfriend you had was really nice too.
Don't worry. I won't be talking about Charlotte ever again.  69 70 71 National Treasure, 4/9/03 27.

You know, Ben, what you need to do is stop reading so much, and go out and have some fun.

Every night, the Declaration of Independence is lowered down into the vault room which is directly below the Rotunda... CLOSE ON A BLUEPRINT of the National Archives. We FOLLOW Ben's finger as it traces the path down through the Rotun floor and to the Vault Room right below.
...where it's locked up ina specially at sed, impenetrable,  National Treasure, 4/9/03 28.

50-ton, steel vault where it's protected from heat, cold, even a thousand years of nuclear winter. The entire process takes just two minutes, but during those two Minutes, the Declaration of Independence is vulnerable.

--Whoa-wait-whoa! Holy shit! Ritey's "holy shit" ECHOES LOUDLY through the room. ALL HEADS turn to glare at them. Riley lowers his voice.

Ben and Riley wait. "DR. ABIGAIL CHASE, CHARTERS OF FREED CUSTODIAN" is stenciled on the office door.

(reluctantly) Because there's a treasure map on the back.
Is this a joke?

Have you ever touched it?

That must frustrate you. Seeing something everyday and not being able to touch it. There's an undeniable charm about Ben, but Abigail does h best to shrug it off.
I touch the case every day, which is closer than most people will ever get to it. Which makes me the expert in this room about there being or not being a map on the back. Which there is not.

Or, the parchment could have been palim sest. Animal skin paper wasn't exactly easy to make and was--

Of course, you do.

It was in a riddle on an old pipe.  73 National Treasure, 4/9/03 32.

Brown. Paul Brown. And this is my friend, Tom Jeffries. She shakes his hand.

text: IN THE FOYER, Ben pushes by guests, almost to the exit... IN THE SECURITY STATION, Woodruff turns the key on the 17 console and prays...
Please be there...please God, let it be there...
Carrying the "souvenir," Ben hurries down the sidewalk in front of the National Archives.
Hey! Abigail catches up to him, but Ben keeps moving.
What's that?
What's what?
Ian and his men burst out the back service exit.
The vault's steel doors slide open, revealing the bad new

head_text.subj: THE DECLARATION OF INDEPENDENCE IS GONE

text: Woodruff sees the empty vault on the surveillance screen. He hits the ALARM and gets on his radio.
Code Red. Code Red. We have a break in! Lock it down. Nobody leaves the building. Woodruff looks around. He can't believe this is happening
Romebody get the FBI on the phone! ow!  182 183 184 National Treasure, 4/9/03 53.
Abigail follows Ben as he hurries across the street.
What's that? That in your hand.
A souvenir. Got it at the gift shop. They reach the van, where Riley waits, engine running.
Let's go! Just then, the National Archives ALARMS SOUND! Abigail's face falls. She knows what Ben has done.
You didn't.
You wouldn't understand. Ben reaches for the van door, but Abigail SCREAMS...
Ben panics, grabs her, covers her mouth, but she BITES hi and...COMES UP WITH THE DECLARATION OF INDEPENDENCE.
As Ian and his men climb into their catering truck, Ian sees... Ben standing across the street with Abigail who is holdin the Declaration of Independence.
Abigail looks at the rolled up parchment, incredulous.
Careful with that!
Oh. My. God. Riley sees she has IT now and puts his head in his hands.
(sotto) Oh my God.  National Treasure, 4/9/03 54.
(to Abigail) You're making a big mistake--
--You weren't protecting it. You're stealing it.
Listen. There are some very bad people, people who don't care about the Declaration of Independence, people who only see it as a map.
You're pathetic. With that, she turns and starts crossing the street, the Declaration of Independence in her hand. Ben hurries to get into the van.
Come on. Let's go. Riley watches Abigail leaving with the Declaration.
But. You can't just let her go.

Yes, we can. Suddenly, the CATERING TRUCK barrels down on Abigail in t middle of the street. She side-steps out of its way, but it SCREECHES TO A STOP in front of her, blocking her path Ben sees the truck's driver...it's Shippen.

Oh no. The truck's back doors burst gpen, and Ian, Shaw, and Pow jump out and swarm Abigail. She struggles like a wild cat Ben moves to help her, but Powell opens fire on him, send Ben diving for cover behind the van.
Riley ducks as the van is raked with bullets. The van's windows shatter. Glass shards pepper the interior.
Ian and Shaw throw Abigail into the back of the truck. Powell jumps into the Cab, and the truck peels out.  187 188 189 190 191 192 193 194 195 National Treasure, 4/9/03
Ben jumps in, and Riley slams it into gear.
The catering truck wheels through traffic. A beat behind, the van blows through a red light and flies after it.
Abigail holds the Declaration of Independence. Ian holds out his hand.
Give it to me.
Over my dead body.
The catering truck turns hard and slews onto 3rd Street. A dozen POLICE CARS speed by them, going the other way, toward the National Archives.
The truck veers suddenly, sending Abigail on her ass. Ian snatches the Declaration of Independence out of her hand she stumbles.

A scenic street if anyone had time to look. The U.S. Capi on one side, the Washington Monument on the other. The van gains on the catering truck, but Powell leans out the passenger side window and OPENS FIRE.
Ben and Riley duck as the front windshield EXPLODES.
The van falls back.
Abigail watches helplessly as Ian holds the Declaration o Independence.
Ian ignores her. Slips the document from its cover.
What do we do with her? Ian starts unrolling the document. Doesn't look up.
No witnesses. Shaw turns his gun on Abigail. Abigail's eyes search the truck. Looking for a way out...
Riley pulls alongside the driver's side of the catering truck, then he YANKS the wheel hard...
The van SLAMS into the catering truck just as...

Shaw cocks his gun, squeezes the trigger, but the truck shakes violently ON IMPACT, sending Shaw on his ass. Abigail scrabbles to the truck's back doors, but they're latched shut. Irked, Shaw moves to finish her off. But just then, Ian notices something about the document that makes him go...
Wait. Ian looks up, then turns the document to Abigail.
What the hell is this? Abigail looks at the document, and is dust as surprised a Ian. Stamped on the document is a PRI . e grins.
A souvenir.
The van slaloms traffic and pulls alongside the truck.
Ian looks to Abigail, who stands by the truck's back door
Who are you?  200 201 202 203 204 205 206 207 National Treasure, 4/9/03 57.
Abigail talks, she reaches behind her back and surreptitiously unlatches the door latch...
(stalling) I'm Dr. Abigail Chase, Executive Custodian of the Charters of Freedom for the National Archives.
Ben moves to the back of the van and slides open the van' side door.
Shippen sees Ben in the van and whips the steering wheel.
The catering truck YAWS into the van.
Abigail finally manages to unlatch the latch.

Who are you-- Just then, the truck is rocked as it SLAMS into the van. Ian and Shaw are buried by a cascade of chafing dishes. The truck's back doors to SWING OPEN WILDLY. Abigail just manages to grab the latch, and she ARCS OUT INTO traffic.
A TOUR BUS motors along in the heavy D.C. traffic, passin the Jefferson Memorial, beautifully lit at night.
A GROUP OF TOURISTS crane their necks out their windows a a TOUR GUIDE zealously describes the sights.
...And over to your right, you can see the Jefferson Memorial. Who can tell me what important document Thomas Jefferson authored? Nobody answers. Instead, they're all glued to the action.
Abigail dangles off the door, both hands gripping the lat  208 209 210 211 212 213 214 215 National Treasure, 4/9/03 58.
Riley maneuvers the van up to the back of the catering tr Ben holds onto the door frame and reaches out to Abigail.
Grab my hand! Holding on for dear life, she looks to Ben like he's craz
With what?!
Riley fights the wheel, holding steady. Looks ahead_to se A TRAFFIC JAM. Total gridlock. A sea of red brake lights.
Uh... hurry!
Ben reaches for Abigail.
Come on! Abigail summons up her courage, lets go of one hand, and SWINGS toward Ben. Their fingers almost touch...
But there's no more room to go. Riley brakes...
The van and Ben suddenly decelerate away from Abigail who almost falls.
The van falls back, and Shippen looks ahead and sees why. PARKED CARS locked in traffic. Shippen SLAMS on the brake
The catering truck tires BURN RUBBER.

The sudden stop sends Ian and Shaw asses over elbows. The truck's doors SWING ABIGAIL BACK INSIDE, then close behind her. Abigail's now back in the truck in front of a angry firing squad. Shaw turns his gun on her...  216 217 218 219 220 221 222 National Treasure, 4/9/03 59.
Ben hurries to the back of the catering truck and yanks t handle just as...

Shaw SHOOTS! But Abigail disappears as the truck door swi open again. The errant bullets blow out the windshield of AN ONCOMING TANKER TRUCK. The tanker truck driver yanks the wheel hard and slams on his brakes.
The tanker truck JACK-KNIFES...
Ian and Shaw watch in horror as the jack-knifed tanker tr slews uncontrollably toward them. They dive out of the truck.
Shippen lays on his HORN, not seeing what Powell sees in his rearview mirror....the runaway juggernaut.
POWELL and other MOTORISTS SCRAMBLE out of their cars, DUCKING and DIVING out of the way of the TANKER TRUCK... ...which SHIPPEN finally sees. Too late.

head_text.subj: THE TANKER TRUCK CRASHES INTO THE BACK OF THE CATERING
EACH CAR IN FRONT OF THE CATERING TRUCK PLOWS INTO THE CA

text: in front of it. Metal crumples, glass shatters, tires POP IAN, SHAW, and POWELL come up from the smoking mayhem. Ia looks down the shoulder where he sees... BEN and RILEY'S VAN blow past the pile-up. The van pulls off an off-ramp and disappears.
Piss!
Riley drives, pedal to the metal. Ben sits in the back with a flustered Abigail.  222 National Treasure, 4/9/03 60.
You all right?
No, I'm not all right! Where's the Declaration of Independence? She immediately starts searching the van. Riley glances i the rearview mirror and sees her searching the van.
What do you mean "where is it"? You had it!
I didn't have it. He gave me a fake. Riley looks to Ben, surprised.
You did? (between his teeth) Then, why'd we go after her, Ben?
Ben? I thought your name was Paul.
I had to lie. My real name is Ben Gates. Benjamin Franklin Gates.
I'm supposed to believe that?
Being named after one of America's founding fathers is sort of like a tradition in my family.
An obsession, actually.
Where is the real the Declaration of Independence?
Don't worry. It's safe. Abigail stops searching. Eyes him.
So you did steal it.
If I hadn't, those men would have.  222 223 224 225 National Treasure, 4/9/03 61.
Give it to me. I have to return it.
I can't let you do that. That guy who tried to kill you will just come after it again.
We'll warn the authorities. They'll protect it.
Like they did tonight?
The building is now cordoned off and swarming with POLICE
MEN and WOMEN in FBI blazers enter with Woodruff. Leading the group is SADUSKY (40s), solidly built, a complete pro
What're we dealing with?
A break-in.
The detained guests wait impatiently in the Rotunda. Sadu and his team enters and take charge of the room.
All right, my name is Sadusky. I am Agent In Charge. I want this building cleared and sealed off. Security clearance only. Sadusky turns to a female agent, AGENT DAWES.
A complete list of names of everyone on tonight's guest list and their dates. Find out who's NOT here. Agent Dawes peels off, and Sadusky turns to AGENT JOHNSON

The vault and dobby security dogs and all the surveillance tapes for the last 30 days. Agent Johnson nods and peels off, and Sadusky turns to tw more agents, AGENT COLFAX and AGENT HENDRICKS.  National Treasure, 4/9/03 62.
The cars in the underground parking garage. Find any not accounted for. Colfax and Hendricks leave, and Sadusky turns to Woodruff
I want the names and shift schedules of everybody with access to the building. From the janitors to the curator.
Yes, sir.
Now, Mr. Woodruff, if you can please tell me what exactly was taken? Woodruff gulps, can barely choke out the words...
Riley pulls onto a highway.
There's no map on the back of the Declaration of Independence.
Ever heard of the Templar Knights?
they were a military order of the Catholic Church dissolved by the Pope in the 14th century.
After King Philip of France had them all burned at the stake.
That's only a legend.

The Templar Knights are what legends are made of. Noble men with no allegiance to any state or ruler. Their cause was to protect innocent people from tyrannical rulers and oppression. n 1307, they broke into a Wasigothic stronghold in Languedoc, France and found a treasure so massive it took six days to exhume. They had taken a vow of poverty and swore to protect the treasure, using it only for the (MORE )
National Treasure, 4/9/03 63.

noblest purpose. King Philip wanted the treasure...if he could only find it. He had the Knights arrested and tortured, but none ever confessed to the treasure's whereabouts. The few Knights who'd evaded capture hid the treasure for almost 200 years, then finally brought it to he one place where there were no kings and no religious persecution, the New World. Christopher Columbus, not so coincidentally, was a descendant of the Knights.
What do the pempiar Knights have to do with the Declaration’ Ben pulls_a one-dollar bill out of his pocket and points the symbols on the back.

The all-seeing eye. The unfinished pyramid. These are the marks of the Templar. Our founding fathers were descendants of the Knights. They put the map on the back. Abigail just looks at Ben. An incredulous beat, then...
This is crazy. I'm calling the police. Stop the car. Riley doesn't slow down.
You wish to add kidnapping to your list of federal offenses?
You can get out whenever you want. Abigail glances out the window. They're going about 7@mph
Fine. I will! She reaches for the door handle.
Do you still want to hear the riddle from the pipe? That stops Abigail. She turns him, listening.  226 227 National Treasure, 4/9/03 64.
"The legend writ, the stain effected The key in Silence undetected Fifty-five in iron pen Mr. Matlack can't offend."
Timothy Matlack? The calligrapher of the Declaration of Independence?
The pipe came from Mt. Vernon. Abigail digests this, incredulous.
If that's true, the pipe is a major American historical find.
Yeah well, Ian already has it, and he'll take the Declaration too if we don't protect it.
How do I know you're not lying?
We look at the back. Abigail considers that, then looks Ben square in the eye.
All right. But if there's nothing on the back, you're turning yourselves in.
Deal. Because if there's nothing on the back, the Declaration's safe.
Two EMTs work on Guard Ferguson who is conscious now. He sits propped up against a wall, talking to Agent Dawes.
The_only thing I remember is the smell of my hair burning. ON SADUSKY who approaches. Agent Dawes nods to Guard Ferguson, then joins Sadusky down the hall.
They got him with a taser gun at the service entrance.  227 228 National Treasure, 4/9/03 65.
Did he see the shooter? Anything? Agent Dawes shakes her head, no.
FBI_ forensics TECHNICIANS work the crime scene, studying bullet casings and dusting for fingerprints. Sadusky move down the corridor with Dr. Herbert and Woodruff.
Rounds were fired, and nobody heard anything?
The vault corridor is lined with three feet of steel and concrete. Sadusky studies the walls pocked with bullet holes.
We get a description from the guards?
Which guards?
The guards that were fired upon.
There were no guards on patrol down here. Sadusky moves to the elevator which is also bullet-riddle
Then, who were the thieves shooting at? Just then, Agent Colfax calls from the stalled elevator.

Found it! Sadusky, Woodruff and Dr. Herbert move to... THE ELEVATOR. Agent Hendricks stands above the elevator car in the shaft. He hands THE EMPTY THERMOPANE DISPLAY CASE down to Agent Colfax from its hiding place.
Looks like they used a dibasic acid to dissolve the bolts. Dr. Herbert looks so broken up, he just might cry.  National Treasure, 4/9/03 66.
Dr. Herbert 228
Get a copy of the Declaration in place before opening tomorrow.
Yes, absolutely.
No word goes to the public. Everything is to appear normal. does his best to compose himself.
Who would do such a thing?
Anti-government terrorists. Just then, Agent Johnson steps up.
Computerized security records indicate that a Dr. Abigail Chase accessed the vault at 9:32pm tonight.
Dr. Chase? Impossible. I was with her at that time. Agent Johnson shows Sadusky a copy of Abigail's ID photo. Dr. Herbert approaches,
Who is she?
The Charters of Freedom Custodian.
The one in charge of the Declaration of Independence.
Where is she? Let's talk to her.
Unaccounted for, sir. is upset by the news. Now, Agent Dawes carrying a computer printout.
A man named Benjamin Gates used his credit card in the gift shop at 9:39pm. He wasn't on the guest list. We got an address from the credit card company.  228 229 230 231 National Treasure, 4/9/03 67.
Gift shop? What the hell did this * guy buy?

Ben roots around under the seat. Comes up with a Big-Gulp cup. Tosses it aside. Finally comes up with a cardboard mailing tube. He peels off an old cheeseburger wrapper stuck to it, then hands it to Abigail. *
Here. Abigail opens the tube and partially pulls out the docume The aged parchment is clearly visible through the plastic She's awe-struck.
You are not to touch this ever again! She slips the document back inside the tube.
Fine by me. I never wanted to touch it in the first place.
You don't deserve to touch it.
Let's just look at the map. That way nobody will ever have to touch it again.
Not here.
What do you mean "not here"?

Not in the back of a van. We'll need chemicals. A controlled environment. A clean room with particulate air filtration. ESD attire. I hope you have all that. CUT TO - A DOOR BURSTS OPEN, and a SWAT TEAM swarms in, a in black, bullet-proof gear, helmets, lights, guns. We WIDEN to reveal that we're in...

Shrouds of plastic hang over the windows. Beams of light cut through the darkness as the team moves swiftly throug the room. A beat, then a SWAT team member calls out...  231 232 233 National Treasure, 4/9/03 68.
Interior secure!
Sadusky and his team move down the hallway. Agent Dawes reads from a printout.

Ben Franklin Gates used his Visa on a one-way plane ticket from Toronto to D.C. two days ago after spending seven months unaccounted for. Before that, his paper trail's got him all over the place. Boston, France, Boston, Greenland.

The tandlady didn't _want to say much about hil Only that he's rarely here, that he's very nice, and that he always pays his rent, sometimes months in advance. They come to a room cordoned off and guarded by police.
Wait 'til you see this.

Sadusky and his team enter the room and stop suddenly at what they see. We REVERSE and find... We're in Ben's apartment, and everything is now all lined in_ plastic. Every square inch of the room. The windows, walls, carpet, television, and all of the furniture. A CHEMISTRY SET sits on the dresser. A box of BLUE ESD BOOTIES sit near the door. The only other thing not cover is a Xerox copied collection of old handwritten letters. Agent Dawes dons a pair of gloves, picks them up, and stu the letters.
Letters to the editor of The New- England Courant. Written in 1722. She flips through the other letters.
They're all from the same person. (reads a letter) "Your humble servant, Silence Dogood." Agent Hendricks studies the blue booties by the door.  National Treasure, 4/9/03 69.
What's this guy up to?

Profilers say we're looking at an adult male, a loner, has a high IQ but has never been able to hold down a_ job, is socially inept, has probably written numerous letters— o the White House expressing anti- government sentiments. We're expecting him to contact us shortly with ransom demands. Sadusky eyes the "Don't Tread on Me" Flag which is covere in clear plastic.
I don't think he's going to be calling with any ransom demands. 234 CUT TO - A BOTTLE OF SAMUEL ADAMS beer is slammed dow a table. We WIDEN to reveal...
Powell and Shaw sit with Ian who studies the pipe.

Where do you think they went? No response. Ian turns the pipe over, then looks to a cocktail napkin on which he's written the riddle. ON THE NAPKIN, the words "legend" and "key" are underline along with "undetected" and "Silence."
That bastard. He did know something he wasn't telling me. Look at this. (points to a line) * "Legend" and "key" are not the same * thing. "Legend" means map. "Key means key.
The key to the treasure?

During the war, generals used secret codes and ciphers to disguise their communications. To decode the cipher, the recipient needed the "key," like a book or an old letter. * "The key in Silence undetected." * You know why Silence is capitalized? Powell and Shaw exchange a look, then hazard a guess...  National Treasure, 4/9/03 70.
Because...it's important?
Because it's a name.
Ben and Abigail look ahead to see a SEA OF POLICE AND FBI in the parking lot of Ben's apartment building.
What do we do now?
Turn yourselves in.
Go to Hillcrest.
(scoffs, incredulous) We can't go there!
Where?
We need the key to the cipher. I had copies. He has the originals.
Who?
He hates you. He'll turn you in.
Whoever it is, he sounds like a good man.
Oak trees line the street colonial and Queen Anne homes.
Ben knocks on the door and waits with Riley and Abigail. beat, then_a 60-year-old, graying MAN opens the door. He takes one look at Ben, then slams the door. Riley shrugs.
I don't think he recognized me.
I think he's still mad at you for not going to Medical School.  238 National Treasure, 4/9/03 71.
(pounds on the door) Dad! Open the door! I need your help. The man opens the door again. We realize now he's PATRICK GATES, Ben's father. He looks to his son, then to Abigail
Don't tell me. You got her pregnant.
No! Abigail looks down at her stomach, suddenly self consciou
(disappointed) I look pregnant?
(to his dad) I need the Silence Dogood letters.
(incredulous) You have Silence Dogood letters?
Our great great-great -great- randfather George Washington Gates ound a few hidden in an old desk he bought at an auction. No one ever understood their meaning until we found the pipe.
This better not involve Charlotte.
My days of looking for Charlotte are over. I swear.
He's telling the truth, Mr. Gates. Patrick smiles smug as he opens the door to let them in.
I knew it. I knew there was no Charlotte. I told you so.
Dad, let's not do the "I told you so" thing.  National Treasure, 4/9/03 72.
I think after all these years I'm entitled to a little "I told you so." I told you, I told your grandpa, I told your_mother. You people wasting your lives chasing something that doesn't exist--
--All right, dad, you asked for it. Do you really want to know? I. found. Charlotte. That's right. I really found her. That stops Patrick. He looks to Abigail.
I'm not Charlotte. My name is Abigail. Dr. Abigail Chase.
Charlotte was a ship.
I know. She left port from Maine 1779. I wasted seven years searching the coast of France.

She never made it_to France. I found the ship's log of the HMS Erebus, a ship that left port two days before the Charlotte. The captain wrote that his ship barel survived a bad southeaster which figured must have blown the Charlotte off course. That stops Patrick. His eyes flash with excitement.
How far off course?
Ian works on his laptop while Powell and Shaw eat room service food. His computer BEEPS.
(triumphantly) Silence Dogood. Here she is. ON THE COMPUTER SCREEN are the search results for "Silenc and "Declaration of Independence." We notice the name "SILENCE DOGOOD" many times.
Who is it?  239 240 241 National Treasure, 4/9/03 73.
We PUSH IN on the screen, then PULL OUT and as we hear Ag Johnson's voice take over the explanation...
Silence Dogood, a.k.a., Benjamin Franklin. We PULL BACK and realize that we have transitioned to...
Sadusky stands with his team at a make-shift command post The FBI has just run the same Google Search. Agent Johnson reads from his laptop screen.

Ben Franklin was 15 years old, apprenticing for his brother James' newspaper when he secretly wrote 14 letters to the Editor of The Courant using the pen name, Silence Dogood, a middle-aged widowed wife of a Minister. She wrote about colonial life, gained quite a following, and even obtained proposals of marriage. Sadusky regards the copied letters from Ben's apartment.
These letters were written by Benjamin Franklin? Now, Agent Colfax steps up with a sheet of paper.

The gift shop clerk ID'd Gates on the surveillance tapes from earlier in the evening. Sadusky studies Ben's photo. CLOSE ON THE PICTURE, a grainy surveillance image of Ben his tuxedo as he passes through the security checkpoint upon entering the National Archives gala. Sadusky hands the photo back to Agent Colfax.
Release his picture to the press. Dr. Chase's too. Someone's bound to spot them.
Ben clears the dining room table. Abigail helps, but her eyes search the room and stop on...A PHONE. But it's too close to Ben to get to.  National Treasure, 4/9/03 74.
Where's the bathroom?
Down the hall. First door on the right. Abigail disappears into the hall.
Abigail moves down the hall and finds to the bathroom. Directly across the hall is a study. Abigail glances back toward the living room, then ducks into the study.

Packed with books on shelves and_in piles. Abigail moves to a desk and finds a phone cradle...but no phone. She notices a collection of FRAMED BUTTONS hanging on the wal CLOSE ON one of the framed buttons. It's a silver-plated George Washington Inaugural button. There is a note, "Dad Found this in a backyard in Maryland. Love, Ben."
Looking for this? Abigail turns, startled. She sees the phone in Ben's hand
I thought we had a deal.
(covers) Dr. Herbert will be worried about me.
You guys dating?
Yes, and he's going to kill you.
I figured. He looked like your type.
You have no idea what my type is.
I know you don't like treasure hunters.
I like men I can trust.  243 244 National Treasure, 4/9/03 75.
Ben considers that, then hands her the phone and leaves. Abigail looks at the phone in her hand, surprised.
Abigail emerges from the hallway with the phone to find B standing there.
Why did you come after me? You had the Declaration of Independence. You could've just gotten away.
Why didn't you call your boyfriend?
He's not my boyfriend. They look at each other for a moment, then Riley enters.

I parked the van around back. Ben hands Abigail the gloves. She dons them, then opens the tube. They all look at each other for a beat, then... Abigail carefully slips the Declaration of Independence o of the tube. The document practically glows with history. She catches her breath, mesmerized by its power, then gingerly unrolls the document. They are all awe-struck. Now, Patrick enters with a TRAY OF TEA. He goes to set it on the table, right on the Declaration of Independence... ...but Ben quickly intercepts the tray.
Whoa! Not there. Ben grabs the tray from his dad and sets it on the buffet Now, Patrick notices the ancient parchment on the table.
Where'd you get that? It looks old.
A little over 200 years.
Wow. You sure? Ben and Riley exchange knowing looks. Riley nods...
Pretty sure.  244 National Treasure, 4/9/03 76.
What is it?
Just a map.
I don't see anything. He reaches to turn the parchment over, but Ben stops him.
This side. It's invisible ink.
So, put it in the oven.
No!
why not? Ferrous sulfate inks can only be brought out with heat.
But it will damage the--
--parchment. (to his dad) She's right. It's very old. We can't risk compromising the map.
You need a reagent.
I know. Ben grabs a slice of LEMON off the tea tray.
Just the upper right-hand corner.
(peeved) I know.
If there is indeed a secret message, it will be marked with a symbol there first.
I_know.  National Treasure, 4/9/03 77.
He brushes the lemon over the corner of the parchment. They all eagerly...wait...for it to reveal...anything.
Nothing. Riley looks hard at the parchment, ready to jump off the highest building.
Nothing?
You sure it's this side?

It needs heat. With that, Ben leans in and BREATHES on the parchment. As if by magic, the puff of warm breath reveals... A SERIES OF NUMBERS. They appear briefly, flicker, then disappear. But everyone in the room sees them. A wash of silence overcomes them, then...
We need more heat. 245 CUT TO CLOSE ON a hairdryer blowing on a low setting parchment. As it does, a_LONG SERIES OF FADED NUMBERS Slowly emerge: 6.14.7, 4.54.4, 10.1.9...
Oh. My. God.
A series of numbers. 3 per set.
It's an Ottendorf cipher.
George Washington and the Marquis de Lafayette used them to pass secret messages from the front lines.
(covering) Duh

The first number indicates the page in the key, in this case, the set of Silence Dogood letters. The second number in the cipher is the line on that page . And the third is the word on that line.  National Treasure, 4/9/03
Where is the map with the "X"?
There's never a map with an "X."
Then, who started that legend? Abigail studies the numbers, tears welling in her eyes.
This is amazing.
Dad, where're the letters? We need the letters.
(suddenly guilty) When you left, I got rid of everything. As they talk, Abigail picks up the document and holds it to the chandelier light for closer inspection.
Dad, where are they?!
I donated them. Riley hangs his head.
I hope you got a big tax write-off.
Who'd you give them to?
There's only one place for them.
You gave them to the Ben Franklin Museum?
It completed their collection. 78. Abigail excitedly scrutinizes the writing on the Declarat of Independence.
This is a tremendous discovery! All this time. No one knew there was something on the back. 245  245 National Treasure, 4/9/03 79.
On the back of what? Patrick peeks at the front of the document, and his face falls as_he now SEES WHAT'S ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE PARCHMENT. It starts with, "In CONGRESS, July 4th 1776."
Holy shit!
I know.
That's the--
--I know. Patrick digests that, about to blow a gasket, then...
(excited) It's brilliant! | Putting the map on the back of an important document guaranteed the map's survival.
I know.
Um, guys... Riley's attention is drawn to the television in the den. On the screen is the grainy surveillance picture of Ben captioned with his name. Ben goes to the television and turns it up.

...for questioning in connection with an attempted robbery at the National Archives _ tonight. Authorities are also looking for this woman... ON THE SCREEN, a picture of Abigail also appears. Abigail gasps.

...Dr. Abigail Chase, a museum employee who has been reported as missing. Police did not say whether Dr. Chase is a suspect or a witness, only that she is the only National Archives employee not currently accounted for...  245 246 247 National Treasure, 4/9/03 80.
